labels.analysis: The MCP Server is specifically designed to interact with Pinterest, allowing users to search for images, retrieve detailed information about those images, and download them. Its core functionality revolves around image discovery and retrieval from the Pinterest platform, making it a specialized tool for image-based research and content aggregation. The available tools indicate that this server is primarily focused on web-based image search and retrieval, with capabilities that cater to users who need to gather visual content efficiently.
labels.reasoning: The primary label is chosen based on the server's core functionality of searching and retrieving images from Pinterest, which aligns with the "Web Search & Research" category. The secondary label "Content Creation" is included because the tools enable users to collect visual content that can be used in creative or professional projects. The server's functionality is well-covered by predefined categories, so no custom label is necessary.

tools.name: pinterest_search
tools.description: Search for images on Pinterest by keyword

headless.description: Whether to use headless browser mode (default: true)

tools.name: pinterest_search_and_download
tools.description: Search for images on Pinterest by keyword and download them

limit.description: Number of images to return and download (default: 10)

headless.description: Whether to use headless browser mode (default: true)

tools.name: pinterest_search

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@terryso/mcp-pinterest/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
